definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: She is a capable pilot, and a shrewd leader.
sentences.chinese: 她是出色的飛行員和賢明的領導者。

sentences.english: The King ruled his people well and wisely.
sentences.chinese: 這位國王賢明地統治着他的臣民。

sentences.english: Let us offer thanks to our protector, the wise and kind Athene.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們來感謝我們的保佑者，賢明而仁慈的雅典娜神。

sentences.english: You're at risk of losing this last trace, this philosophical reserve.
sentences.chinese: 你就要冒失去這最後的痕跡，這一賢明保留地的風險。

sentences.english: The emperor was also a wise monarch, cherish just and loved just.
sentences.chinese: 皇上也是賢明君主了，惜才，愛才。

sentences.english: A wise man once said that a fool and his money are soon parted .
sentences.chinese: 一個賢明的人曾經說過愚人是留不住財富的。

sentences.english: King Gamani the Righteous invited his wise old teacher to live in the palace.
sentences.chinese: 正直的國王伽摩尼把他那位賢明的老師接到宮殿裏住。

sentences.english: Better a slap from the wise than a kiss from a fool.
sentences.chinese: 寧可讓賢明的人打一耳光，也不願傻瓜來親一口。

sentences.english: A wise ruler is generous in victory.
sentences.chinese: 賢明的統治者在勝利時能寬宏大量。

sentences.english: A judicious parent encourages his children to make their own decisions.
sentences.chinese: 賢明的父親鼓勵兒女自作抉擇。

definition: relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
to strengthen moral ties between people/to have sexual intercourse (of a married couple)
to rely on/to base oneself on
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
great person of the past/venerable forebear/the great and the good
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
